Description:
Job Requirements

We are looking for a highly capable ML Engineer with varying level of experience to support revenue maximization program for COG Travel, A&H DM, Auto and IPL. The ML Engineer will optimize our machine learning systems. You will be evaluating existing machine learning (ML) processes, performing statistical analysis to resolve data set problems, and enhancing the accuracy of our AI software's predictive automation capabilities.

To ensure success as a machine learning engineer, you should demonstrate solid data science knowledge and experience in a related ML role. A first-class machine learning engineer will be someone whose expertise translates into the enhanced performance of predictive automation software.

Responsibilities:
‚Ä¢ - Consulting with managers to determine and refine machine learning objectives.
‚Ä¢ - Designing machine learning systems and self-running artificial intelligence (AI) software to automate predictive models.
‚Ä¢ - Transforming data science... prototypes and applying appropriate ML algorithms and tools.
‚Ä¢ - Ensuring that algorithms generate accurate user recommendations.
‚Ä¢ - Turning unstructured data into useful information by auto-tagging images and text-to-speech conversions.
‚Ä¢ - Solving complex problems with multi-layered data sets, as well as optimizing existing machine learning libraries and frameworks.
‚Ä¢ - Developing ML algorithms to analyse huge volumes of historical data to make predictions.
‚Ä¢ - Running tests, performing statistical analysis, and interpreting test results.
‚Ä¢ - Documenting machine learning processes. Keeping abreast of developments in machine learning.

Work Experience

Technical Knowledge & Skills:
‚Ä¢ - 2-3 Years of Experience as ML Engineer
‚Ä¢ - NLP
‚Ä¢ - Phyton
‚Ä¢ - MLOPs
‚Ä¢ - PySpark
‚Ä¢ - Yaml

Platforms:
‚Ä¢ - Azure
‚Ä¢ - Kubernets
‚Ä¢ - CI/CD

Management:
‚Ä¢ - Agile
‚Ä¢ - Teamwork
‚Ä¢ - Self Motivated

Machine Learning Engineer

We are Kueski, and our mission is to develop an ecosystem of financial products which are simple and convenient for our users.

We are part of the financial digital transformation, being one of the key players in M√©xico.

Our Data Science team plays a key role in accomplishing Kueski`s mission, developing machine learning applications which allow us to make complex assessments in real time, improving our operational processes and making things easy for our clients.

WANTED

We are looking for a passionate machine learning engineer who has a strong software engineering background, and who is passionate about building reliable machine learning systems, building and deploying reliable ML pipelines in production environments and being constantly challenged with complex problems.

You have experience working with data science and machine learning tools (pandas, numpy, sklearn, etc.) and using cloud technologies. Also, you have experience deploying automated... machine learning pipelines (data validation, model training, model validation, model serving, etc.).

REWARD

You will:
‚Ä¢ receive a competitive salary and benefits package.
‚Ä¢ make use of state-of-the-art technologies in real-life situations.
‚Ä¢ be part of a team consisting of sharp and collaborative members.
‚Ä¢ be a key element building core components of our decisioning system.
‚Ä¢ create models and systems that enable amazing products.

Come and join an awesome company, which is a key participant of a great industry.

APPLY

Kueski focuses on Financial Services, Finance, and Credit. Their company has offices in Guadalajara. They have a mid-size team that's between 51-200 employees. To date, Kueski has raised $36.3M of funding; their latest round was closed on April 2016.

You can view their website at http://www.kueski.com or find them on Twitter

About Aviva
We are a Mexico City-based technology startup following a unique approach to unsecured credit for underserved communities. Aviva‚Äôs physical onboarding kiosks build a bridge to those living in remote communities and provide a documentless 3-minute video onboarding for everyone in need of liquidity. This asset-light acquisition strategy, combined with a superior risk model based on computer vision and natural language processing, will allow Aviva to offer the lowest interest rates available to today‚Äôs underserved.

Our Founding Team
We are a team of entrepreneurs and experienced finance professionals, who have built unicorn startups and managed blue-chip banking operations worldwide. After driving innovation in lending in Mexico for the past two decades, we have just closed a 7-digit USD seed round to create impact for the underbanked.

What you will do
‚Ä¢ Produce Video-based models to bring financial products to the traditionally unbanked
‚Ä¢ Iterate fast through... experimentation and monitoring
‚Ä¢ Conduct deep-dive analysis to understand highly complex problems
‚Ä¢ Design strategies on topics like data acquisition and risk management
‚Ä¢ Ensure that our systems are scalable, reliable, and extensible
‚Ä¢ Degree in STEM field
‚Ä¢ 3+ years experience with conducting Computer Vision research using Deep learning models (CNN, Transformers, etc) and frameworks (PyTorch, Tensorflow, etc.)
‚Ä¢ Experience with end-to-end ML systems, cloud platforms, data pipelines and model monitoring
‚Ä¢ Extraordinary modelling skills
‚Ä¢ Relevant experience in video-processing using ML solutions is a plus
‚Ä¢ Experience in NLP and/or Fintech is a big plus
‚Ä¢ Creative and strategic approach in solving hard people and technical problems
‚Ä¢ Ability to drive clarity and impact when engaging with internal and external stakeholders
‚Ä¢ Join us in building our second unicorn
‚Ä¢ Attractive compensation package with stock options
‚Ä¢ Fast-paced environment with many growth opportunities
‚Ä¢ Relocation package & excellent medical coverage
‚Ä¢ 15 annual vacation days
‚Ä¢ Possibility to work remote 2-3 days per week

Data Scientist ‚Äì S&P Global Commodity Insights

S&P Global is looking for a data scientist who will part of our Data Science and Modelling team, the ideal candidate should be highly motivated and goal-oriented, with an encouraging attitude of working in a very dynamic work environment with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams.

Job summary:

As a Data Scientist at S&P Global, you will apply your advanced analytics skills to transform our vast datasets into tangible business value. You will slice and dice data, analyse information, communicate your findings and collaborate on product development. Outcome of your work will serve multiple business purposes, from commercialized software solution development, driving internal business decisions, to consulting external clients.

Responsibilities:

‚Ä¢ The candidate will drive business decisions based on the insight obtained from the data.

‚Ä¢ Strong problem-solving skills with an emphasis on product development.

‚Ä¢ Selecting... features, building and optimizing machine learning techniques to improve the accuracy of new products.

‚Ä¢ Analyse data for trends and patterns, understanding insight from data with a unbiassed mindset.

‚Ä¢ Implement different analytical methodologies to help solve various problems related to the energy industry.

‚Ä¢ Close collaboration with software developers and machine learning engineers in the implementation of analytical models into production or commercialization.

‚Ä¢ Develop and utilize algorithms to perform error analysis to improve model uniformity and accuracy.

‚Ä¢ Communicate your findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

‚Ä¢ Comfort working in a very dynamic, research-oriented team with several projects under construction in parallel.

Required Qualifications:

‚Ä¢ Advanced degree in a highly quantitative field: Computer Science, Machine Learning, Geology, Statistics, Mathematics, etc.

‚Ä¢ Proficiency with data mining, knowledge of probability theory and advanced statistical techniques.

‚Ä¢ Experience with regression analysis (beyond linear regression), supervised learning, unsupervised learning or time-series analysis.

‚Ä¢ Experience with scientific scripting languages (e.g., Python, R, Matlab)

‚Ä¢ Experience accessing and manipulating data in SQL database environments.

‚Ä¢ Excellent communication and presentation skills. The candidate must be able to effectively communicate with management, reservoir characterization teams, engineering teams, clients, and other stake holders.

Preferred Qualifications:

‚Ä¢ Recent work or internship experience in an advanced data analytics role.

‚Ä¢ Experience with object-oriented programming (e.g., C#/C++, Java).

‚Ä¢ Knowledge of deep learning and related toolkits: Tensorflow, PyTorch, Keras, etc.

‚Ä¢ Knowledge of the energy industry, understanding the different challenges and potential solutions.

Equal Opportunity Employer

S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment.

Who You'll Work With You‚Äôll be based in Mexico city, and will be part of a close-knit and agile data-science team.

Your colleagues

You will work with other data scientists, data engineers, machine learning engineers, designers and project managers on interdisciplinary projects, using maths, stats and machine learning to derive structure and knowledge from raw data across various industry sectors.

Who you are

You are a highly collaborative individual who is capable of laying aside your own agenda, listening to and learning from colleagues, challenging thoughtfully and prioritizing impact. You search for ways to improve things and work collaboratively with colleagues. You believe in iterative change, experimenting with new approaches, learning and improving to move forward quickly

Our Tech Stack

While we advocate for using the right tech for the right task, we often leverage the following technologies: Python, PySpark, TensorFlow, PyTorch, SQL, Airflow, Databricks, our own OSS... called Kedro (check out a Kedro tutorial video here), container technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes, cloud solutions such as AWS, GCP or Azure, and more!

What You'll Do

As a Data Scientist at QuantumBlack in Mexico...

You will work in multi-disciplinary environments harnessing data to provide real-world impact for organisations globally.

You will influence many of the recommendations our clients need to positively change their businesses and enhance performance.

Role responsibilities
‚Ä¢ Work on complex and extremely varied data sets from some of the world‚Äôs largest organisations to solve real world problems
‚Ä¢ Develop data science products and solutions for clients as well as for our data science team
‚Ä¢ Write highly optimized code to advance our internal Data Science Toolbox
‚Ä¢ Work in a multi-disciplinary environment with specialists in machine learning, engineering and design
‚Ä¢ Add real-world impact to your academic expertise, as you are encouraged to write ‚Äòblack‚Äô papers and present at meetings and conferences should you wish
‚Ä¢ Attend conferences such as NIPS and ICML as one global team as well as Data Science retrospectives where you will have the opportunity to share and learn from your co-workers.
‚Ä¢ Work within one of the largest and most advanced data science teams in London, support the Lead Data Scientists to develop data science products

What you‚Äôll learn
‚Ä¢ How successful projections on real world problems across a variety of industries are completed through referencing past deliveries of end to end machine learning pipelines
‚Ä¢ Build products alongside the Core engineering team and evolve the engineering process to scale with data, handling complex problems and advanced client situations
‚Ä¢ Be able to focus on modelling by working alongside the Data Engineering team which focuses on the wrangling, clean-up and transformation of data.
‚Ä¢ Best practices in software development and productionise machine learning by working with our Machine Learning Engineering teams which optimise code for model development and scale it
‚Ä¢ Work with our UX and Visual Design teams to interpret your complex models into stunning and user-focused visualisations
‚Ä¢ Using new technologies and problem-solving skills in a multicultural and creative environment

You will work on the frameworks and libraries that our teams of Data Scientists and Data Engineers use to progress from data to impact. You will guide global companies through data science solutions to transform their businesses and enhance performance across industries including healthcare, automotive, energy and elite sport.
‚Ä¢ Real-World Impact ‚Äì No project is ever the same; we work across multiple sectors, providing unique learning and development opportunities internationally.
‚Ä¢ Fusing Tech & Leadership ‚Äì We work with the latest technologies and methodologies and offer first class learning programmes at all levels.
‚Ä¢ Multidisciplinary Teamwork - Our teams include data scientists, engineers, project managers, UX and visual designers who work collaboratively to enhance performance.
‚Ä¢ Innovative Work Culture ‚Äì Creativity, insight and passion come from being balanced. We cultivate a modern work environment through an emphasis on wellness, insightful talks and training sessions.
‚Ä¢ Striving for Diversity ‚Äì With colleagues from over 40 nationalities, we recognise the benefits of working with people from all walks of life.

Our projects range from helping pharmaceutical companies bring lifesaving drugs to market quicker to optimising a Formula1 car‚Äôs performance. At QuantumBlack you have the best of both worlds; all the benefits of being part of one of the leading management consultancies globally and the autonomy to thrive in a fast growth tech culture:
‚Ä¢ Healthcare Efficiency ‚Äì We helped a healthcare provider improve their clinical trial practices by identifying congestion in diagnostic testing as a key indicator of admissions breaches.
‚Ä¢ Environmental Impact ‚Äì We designed and built the first data-driven application for a state of the art centre of excellence in urban innovation by collecting real-time data from environmental sensors across London and deploying proprietary analytics to find unexpected patterns in air pollution.
‚Ä¢ Product Development ‚Äì We worked with the CEO of an elite automotive organisation to reduce the 18-month car development timeframe by improving processes, designs and team structures.

Qualifications
‚Ä¢ University degree with excellent academic record; MSc level in the field of computer science, artificial intelligence, applied statistics, mathematics with applied practical experience and programming background is highly desired
‚Ä¢ 2+ years of professional experience in applying machine learning and data mining techniques to real problems with copious amounts of data
‚Ä¢ Experience in computer science, engineering, statistics, physics, mathematics, operations research or equivalent technical field
‚Ä¢ Ability to independently own and drive model development, balancing demands and deadlines
‚Ä¢ Ability to prototype statistical analysis and modeling algorithms and apply these algorithms for data driven solutions to problems in new domains
‚Ä¢ Experience in working with large datasets and relational databases is highly desirable (SQL)
‚Ä¢ Programming skills in Python and at least 1 of the following language: R, Scala, SQL
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of distributed computing or NoSQL technologies is a plus
‚Ä¢ Proven application of advanced analytical and statistical methods
‚Ä¢ Experience in the real world application of machine learning methods and algorithms
‚Ä¢ Ability to communicate complex ideas effectively ‚Äì both verbally and in writing ‚Äì in English and Spanish
‚Ä¢ Willingness to travel

A little bit about us:

We are Belvo, a financial API platform with the bold vision of democratizing access to financial services in Latin America. We enable any company or developer to access and interpret their end-users‚Äô financial information. We are turning the rich and diverse Latin American financial ecosystem into a set of developer-friendly tools and APIs.

We‚Äôre a highly-technical, passionate and driven team. We are more than 100 people, our team currently represents 26 nationalities and we have offices in Barcelona, Mexico City, and S√£o Paulo - while a large portion of us works remotely.

We are tackling a very stimulating problem: connecting fintech innovators with legacy financial infrastructure. We strive to go beyond the limits of what is possible today and to do so in an elegant and developer-first way.

Since starting our adventure in May 2019, we have raised $56m from the leading VC investors globally.

You can read more about our company here and about our team and... culture here. Also, head to our blog for more news about our growth and how we have fun together.

About the team:
‚Ä¢ We work in cross-functional, autonomous teams. We follow continuous delivery best practices executed on top of a modern technology stack.
‚Ä¢ Our products are built for developers, by developers. Technological excellence is at the heart of what we do.
‚Ä¢ We are pragmatic and customer-focused. We strive to find the right set of trade-offs in order to validate our hypothesis as early as possible, iterating on our products based on customer feedback.
‚Ä¢ We communicate transparently. We do weekly all-hands where we get together to discuss company performance and goals.
‚Ä¢ We are a flexible international team focused on creating cool stuff. Some of us prefer to work together in one of our offices and others prefer remote. For us, there's no difference as long as you have an excellent internet connection and are able to overlap with the team between 3 pm and 6 pm, CEST timezone.
‚Ä¢ Also, we are backed by some of the leading investors in Silicon Valley and Latin America, including Founders Fund, Kaszek Ventures, and YCombinator.

Your Opportunity:
‚Ä¢ Communicate with data scientists to understand the frameworks and models built
‚Ä¢ Develop and deploy scalable tools and services to enable machine learning training and inference by the data scientists
‚Ä¢ NOT take offline models data scientists build and turn them into a real machine learning production system
‚Ä¢ Identify and evaluate new technologies to improve performance, maintainability, and reliability of our machine learning systems
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with the data team in the design of the data pipelines and engineering infrastructure to support our machine learning systems
‚Ä¢ Facilitate the development and deployment of proof-of-concept machine learning systems

This position may be for you if:
‚Ä¢ You understand the tools used by data scientists
‚Ä¢ You have a strong background in software development
‚Ä¢ You have built MLOps pipelines before

‚Ä¢ You have strong communication skills and can easily communicate with backend engineers, ML engineers, and business stakeholders

Amazing if:

‚Ä¢ Experience with Docker and ECS

‚Ä¢ Experience with AWS ecosystem
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of frameworks such as Keras, PyTorch, Tensorflow
‚Ä¢ Experience with Amazon‚Äôs Sage Maker

Our tech stack:
‚Ä¢ We‚Äôre building our platform using modern technologies, putting the focus on reliability and long-term maintainability
‚Ä¢ We primarily use Python on the backend. We use battle-tested technologies such as Django, and we are heavy users of Python‚Äôs asyncio for some parts of our stack
‚Ä¢ We use Javascript, Vue.js, and Sass on the frontend. We are developing and leveraging our own design system and component library
‚Ä¢ We run our infrastructure on top of Amazon Web Services, leveraging managed services. We tend to favor the use of managed services wherever possible, in order to focus on our business problems
‚Ä¢ We observe and monitor our services using Datadog
‚Ä¢ We follow Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery best practices

Our process steps:

‚Ä¢ Team fit chat

How you will contribute

What you will bring

A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career and the following experience and knowledge:

‚Ä¢ Experience of a wide variety of languages and tools (e.g. script languages) to retrieve, merge and combine data

What you will bring

More about this role

‚Ä¢ Maintaining system architecture: Co-ordinating and ensuring best practice for System level tasks such as : naming convention (table, column), structure of the library as per the best practice

C3 AI is seeking both Jr. and Sr. Quality Automation Assurance Engineers to work with Engineering, Product Development, QA, Operations, and Customer Services to drive the software quality automation for our existing and emerging products.

This is a hands-on role primarily focused on enhancing our test automation framework and developing automated test cases. You will collaborate with QA and performance engineers to improve productivity and testing execution time. This role also participates in the validation and sign-off for all product software releases.

Reporting to the Director of Quality Assurance Engineering, you will be part of a team of highly skilled QA and performance engineers to ensure that we are shipping the highest quality software possible. This is a great opportunity to work with cutting-edge artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies.
